title: Track 1: Infrastructure & Build Foundation
description: Foundation layer for packaging system. No dependencies - can start immediately. Estimated 6-10 hours total.
design: Create Python package structure, Docker infrastructure, and configuration system as defined in PACKAGING_SPEC.md sections 3-4 and 8.
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] pyproject.toml exists with correct metadata and entry points
- [ ] Docker files created and validated
- [ ] Configuration system defined and documented
- [ ] All components verified and ready for dependent tracks

title: Create installer package and infrastructure phase
description: Phase 3-4 of installer: Python package and Docker infrastructure installation. See PACKAGING_SPEC.md section 7.1.
design:
Implement installer phases:
Phase 3 - Python Package:
- Install blueplane package (pip install or from source)
- Verify entry points (bp, bp-server)
- Create default configuration
- Set up environment variables

Phase 4 - Docker Infrastructure:
- Pull Redis image
- Build processing server image
- Set up docker-compose
- Start containers with health checks
- Verify containers running
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] Python package installed successfully
- [ ] Entry points (bp, bp-server) functional
- [ ] Default config created
- [ ] Redis image pulled
- [ ] Processing server image built
- [ ] Containers started with docker-compose
- [ ] Health checks passing
- [ ] Rollback on failure

title: Set up PyPI publishing workflow
description: PyPI distribution setup for blueplane package. See PACKAGING_SPEC.md section 11.1.
design:
Set up PyPI publishing:
- Configure PyPI credentials (token-based)
- Create build workflow (python -m build)
- Test on TestPyPI first
- Automated publishing via GitHub Actions
- Version tagging strategy
- Changelog generation
- Release notes template
- Rollback strategy
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] PyPI account and token configured
- [ ] Build process validated
- [ ] TestPyPI publishing working
- [ ] Production PyPI publishing configured
- [ ] GitHub Actions workflow created
- [ ] Version tagging documented
- [ ] Can publish new releases easily

title: Track 3: Claude Code Integration
description: Complete Claude Code hooks system with installation and verification. Depends on Track 1 (config) and Track 2 (Redis). Estimated 1-2 days.
design: Complete 5 required hooks, create installation script with settings.json modification, implement verification system. Some hooks already exist in src/capture/claude_code/hooks/.
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] All 5 hook files complete and tested
- [ ] Installation script handles hooks and settings.json
- [ ] Verification script validates installation
- [ ] Integration with Redis streams working
- [ ] Ready for end-to-end testing

title: Create Claude hooks verification script
description: Script to verify Claude Code hooks installation and functionality. See PACKAGING_SPEC.md section 6.2.
design:
Create scripts/verify_claude_hooks.py that:
- Checks hook files exist in correct location
- Validates settings.json has hooks enabled
- Tests Redis connection from hooks
- Verifies hook file permissions
- Optionally sends test events through hooks
- Reports detailed status
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] scripts/verify_claude_hooks.py created
- [ ] Checks all hook files present
- [ ] Validates settings.json configuration
- [ ] Tests Redis connectivity
- [ ] Returns clear pass/fail status
- [ ] Helpful error messages for troubleshooting

title: Create Docker infrastructure (Dockerfile and docker-compose.yml)
description: Docker container definitions for processing server and Redis. Creates docker/ directory with Dockerfile.server and docker-compose.yml. See PACKAGING_SPEC.md sections 3.1-3.2.
design:
Create docker/ directory with:
- Dockerfile.server: Python 3.11 slim-based image with blueplane package, health checks
- docker-compose.yml: Redis (redis:7-alpine) + processing server with volume mounts, health checks, restart policies
- Volume mounts for workspace data access
- Environment variable pass-through
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] docker/ directory created
- [ ] Dockerfile.server exists with Python 3.11 base
- [ ] docker-compose.yml defines redis and processing-server services
- [ ] Health checks configured for both services
- [ ] Volume mounts configured for workspace access
- [ ] Can run 'docker-compose config' successfully

title: Create Redis streams initialization script
description: Script to initialize Redis streams for event processing. Sets up required streams, consumer groups, and validates connection.
design:
Create scripts/init_redis.py that:
- Connects to Redis using configuration
- Creates required streams (events, metrics, etc.)
- Sets up consumer groups for processing
- Validates Redis version compatibility
- Tests stream operations
- Supports cleanup/reset mode
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] scripts/init_redis.py created
- [ ] Creates all required Redis streams
- [ ] Sets up consumer groups correctly
- [ ] Validates Redis connection and version
- [ ] Can run idempotently
- [ ] Returns clear status messages

title: Set up Docker Hub publishing workflow
description: Docker Hub distribution for container images. See PACKAGING_SPEC.md section 11.2.
design:
Set up Docker Hub publishing:
- Configure Docker Hub credentials
- Create multi-platform builds (arm64, amd64)
- Automated building via GitHub Actions
- Tag strategy (latest, version tags)
- Image size optimization
- Security scanning
- README and documentation on Docker Hub
- Update notifications
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] Docker Hub account configured
- [ ] Multi-platform builds working
- [ ] GitHub Actions workflow created
- [ ] Tagging strategy implemented
- [ ] Images optimized for size
- [ ] Security scanning enabled
- [ ] Docker Hub README updated
- [ ] Can publish new images easily

title: Track 7: Verification & Distribution
description: Testing suite, publishing automation, and distribution setup. Depends on Track 6 (installer complete). Estimated 2-3 days.
design: Create verification scripts, end-to-end testing, PyPI publishing workflow, Docker Hub publishing, GitHub releases setup.
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] Installation verification script complete
- [ ] End-to-end testing framework working
- [ ] PyPI publishing configured
- [ ] Docker Hub publishing configured
- [ ] GitHub releases automation ready
- [ ] Version management documented
- [ ] Ready for v1.0 release

title: Create installer platform integration phase
description: Phase 5-6 of installer: Claude hooks and Cursor extension installation. See PACKAGING_SPEC.md section 7.1.
design:
Implement installer phases:
Phase 5 - Claude Hooks:
- Run scripts/install_claude_hooks.py
- Verify hooks installed
- Test hook connectivity
- User confirmation for settings.json modification

Phase 6 - Cursor Extension:
- Build VSIX if needed
- Install extension via CLI or prompt user
- Verify extension loaded
- Optional: user can skip if not using Cursor
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] Claude hooks installed via script
- [ ] Hooks verification passing
- [ ] User prompted for settings.json changes
- [ ] Cursor extension installed or skippable
- [ ] Extension verification working
- [ ] Clear status messages
- [ ] Rollback on failure

title: Complete Claude Code hook files (5 hooks)
description: Ensure all 5 required hook files exist and are functional: session_start, session_end, user_prompt_submit, tool_use_pre, tool_use_post. See PACKAGING_SPEC.md section 6.1.
design:
Review and complete hooks in src/capture/claude_code/hooks/:
- session_start.py: Capture session initialization
- session_end.py: Capture session closure
- user_prompt_submit.py: Capture user prompts
- tool_use_pre.py: Capture before tool execution  
- tool_use_post.py: Capture after tool execution
Each hook sends events to Redis streams with proper error handling
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] All 5 hook files exist in src/capture/claude_code/hooks/
- [ ] Each hook properly captures required data
- [ ] Events sent to Redis streams correctly
- [ ] Error handling implemented
- [ ] Hooks tested with Claude Code

title: Track 5: CLI & Service Management
description: CLI interface and macOS service management. Depends on Tracks 1-2 (infrastructure + databases). Estimated 3-5 days.
design: Implement full CLI with Rich UI, create launchd service for macOS auto-start, implement service control and log management.
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] All CLI commands implemented and working
- [ ] Rich terminal UI with tables
- [ ] launchd service configured for macOS
- [ ] Service control working (start/stop/restart)
- [ ] Log viewing and management functional
- [ ] Ready for installer integration

title: Create pyproject.toml with package metadata and dependencies
description: Python package configuration file defining blueplane package structure, dependencies, and entry points for bp and bp-server CLIs. See PACKAGING_SPEC.md section 4.
design:
Use pyproject.toml format with:
- Package metadata (name, version, description, authors, license)
- Dependencies: core (redis, pyyaml, click, rich, sqlite3) and dev (pytest, black, mypy)
- Entry points: bp (CLI) and bp-server (processing server)
- Build system: setuptools with find packages
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] pyproject.toml created at repo root
- [ ] Package metadata complete and accurate
- [ ] All dependencies listed (core + dev)
- [ ] Entry points defined for bp and bp-server
- [ ] Can run 'pip install -e .' successfully

title: Configure GitHub releases and version management
description: GitHub releases automation and version management. See PACKAGING_SPEC.md section 11.
design:
Set up GitHub releases:
- Release automation workflow
- Attach built artifacts (VSIX, install.sh)
- Changelog generation from commits
- Release notes template
- Version bumping strategy (semver)
- Pre-release support
- Asset checksums
- Update mechanisms checking releases API
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] GitHub releases workflow created
- [ ] Artifacts attached to releases
- [ ] Changelog auto-generated
- [ ] Release notes template ready
- [ ] Version management documented
- [ ] Checksums for all assets
- [ ] Update checking validated
- [ ] Ready for v1.0 release

title: Create one-line installer for GitHub distribution
description: One-line curl installer setup for easy distribution. See PACKAGING_SPEC.md section 11.3.
design:
Set up one-line installer:
- Host install.sh on GitHub releases or raw
- Create wrapper script that:
  - Downloads latest install.sh
  - Verifies checksum/signature
  - Executes installation
  - Handles errors
- Support version-specific installation
- Example: curl -fsSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/.../install.sh | bash
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] install.sh hosted on GitHub
- [ ] Curl one-liner works
- [ ] Checksum verification included
- [ ] Version selection supported
- [ ] Error handling robust
- [ ] Documented in README

title: Track 6: Unified Installer
description: Comprehensive bash installation script orchestrating all components. Depends on all Tracks 1-5. Estimated 5-7 days.
design: Create installers/install.sh with 8 phases: prerequisites check, Python package install, Docker setup, Claude hooks, Cursor extension, database init, service setup, verification. Includes error handling, rollback, and one-line installer.
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] All 8 installation phases implemented
- [ ] Prerequisites checking working
- [ ] Error handling and rollback functional
- [ ] User prompts clear and helpful
- [ ] One-line curl installer working
- [ ] Installation verified end-to-end

title: Create installation verification script

design:
Create scripts/verify_installation.py that checks:
- Docker containers running
- Redis connectivity and streams
- SQLite database and schema
- Claude hooks installed and enabled
- Cursor extension installed (optional)
- Processing server healthy
- Configuration valid

- [ ] Returns clear pass/fail for each

Create scripts/test_e2e.sh that:

- Verifies processing by processing server
- Validates data in SQLite
- Tests metrics computation
- Validates session tracking
- Checks error handling

Tests the complete telemetry pipeline

title: Create Claude hooks installation script
description: Script to install Claude Code hooks and modify settings.json to enable them. Handles backup and safe modification. See PACKAGING_SPEC.md section 6.
design:
Create scripts/install_claude_hooks.py that:
- Locates Claude Code settings directory (~/.config/claude-code/)
- Backs up existing settings.json
- Copies hook files to hooks directory
- Modifies settings.json to enable hooks
- Validates settings.json syntax after modification
- Provides rollback on error
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] scripts/install_claude_hooks.py created
- [ ] Locates and backs up settings.json
- [ ] Copies all hook files correctly
- [ ] Modifies settings.json safely
- [ ] Validates JSON syntax
- [ ] Supports --uninstall flag
- [ ] Clear success/error messages
